result.execSummary:
The defendant David Paul Koopmann was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Incident], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes: All applicable costs, fees and surcharges including DNA and DV.  To be paid by 6/11/2016.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.

Court advised defendant due to this DV conviction he may never possess firearms or ammunition.
__
Court ordered defendant successfully complete Batterers Intervention counseling.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. David Paul Koopmann

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Defendant's Bail Forfeiture Notice returned undeliverable.

Sentencing proceeded.   Statements made as to sentencing.   

Court ordered defendant to serve 20 days in the House of Correction, with 20 days credit for time served.  TIME SERVED DISPOSITION.

Court ordered applicable costs, fees and surcharges (including DNA and DV) to be paid by 06/11/2016.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.

Court ordered defendant successfully complete "Batterers intervention" counseling.

Court advised defendant due to this DV conviction he may never possess firearms or ammunition.

Filed:
Victim Impact Statement;
Pretrial Incarceration Credit

Pursuant to plea negotiations, Count 1 is dismissed but read in for the purpose of sentencing.  As to Count 2:
Defendant changes his plea to GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty.   Defendant advised that if not a United States Citizen, deportation is possible.  Court found that defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights.  Guilty Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea.  Court found defendant guilty and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.

Defendant David Paul Koopmann in court with attorney Richard Jeffrey Carpenter.  Defendant David Paul Koopmann in custody.  Thomas L. Potter appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Filed, original amended information; copy served on defendant.  Defendant acknowledges receipt of information, waives formal reading, pleads not guilty.  
Court ordered charge amended to 
Count 1- Attempt Misdemeanor Battery, Domestic Abuse, contrary to Wisconsin Statutes sections 940.19(1), 939.51(3)(a), 939.32 and 968.075(1)(a), a Class A Misdemeanor.
Count 2- Disorderly Conduct, Domestic Abuse, Domestic Abuse-Threat, contrary to Wisconsin Statutes sections 947.01(1), 939.51(3)(b), 968.075(1)(a), 968.075(1)(a)4 , a Class B Misdemeanor.
At the request of the court, and with the consent of the defense and state, hearing on 06/11/2015 is moved from 1:30pm to 8:30am.

Defendant missed court on 05/19/2015.  Defendant is currently in custody on warrant.  Case is adjourned for a Return on Warrant on 06/11/2015 at 1:30pm, in Branch 22.  Parties notified.  This date was chosen due to the District Attorneys charging week and defense attorneys time off.
Notice of bond forfeiture mailed to defendant; Original in file. ($1,000.00 signature bond) ad
Signature bond ordered to be forfeited in the amount of 1000.00.
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE JUDGE ON RETURN OF THE BENCH WARRANT.

Attorney Richard Jeffrey Carpenter in court.  Thomas L. Potter appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered a Bench Warrant to be issued.  Plea and sentencing hearing scheduled on 06/11/2015 at 1:30pm remains on Branch 22's calendar.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.
Bail/bond hearing on May 19, 2015 at 08:30 am.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.  Defendant missed another office visit (05/08/15 and 05/12/15).  Bail review scheduled on 05/19/2015 at 8:30am in Branch 22.

Defendant David Paul Koopmann in court with attorney Richard Jeffrey Carpenter.  Thomas L. Potter appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case in court for scheduling conference.  Defense requests plea and sentencing date.  Case remains calendared in Branch 22.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for June 11, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.

Defendant David Paul Koopmann in court with attorney Richard Jeffrey Carpenter.  Irene Elizabeth Parthum for Thomas Potter appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case in court for scheduling conference.  Defense requests more time.  Case remains calendared in Branch 22.  Scheduling conference scheduled for April 16, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.
Defendant advised No Contact Order remains in full force and effect.

Defendant David Paul Koopmann in court with attorney Richard Jeffrey Carpenter.  Ron Dague for Thomas L. Potter appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  HMP
  Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed.  Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Witkowiak, Branch 22.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant plead not guilty.  Scheduling conference scheduled for March 9, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Filed. Justice Point Pretrial Report dated 3/4/15.
HMP

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision.  ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY to be monitored by portable breathalyzers. Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings. Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Helen K.

Defendant David Paul Koopmann in court with attorney Richard Jeffrey Carpenter.  Defendant David Paul Koopmann in custody.  Carole Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  HMP
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Witkowiak, Branch 22.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 5, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
